snippet: A case involving the mistreatment of more than 100 migrant workers, mostly Indonesians, drew condemnation from the Indonesian Embassy in Kuala Lumpur on Monday.
abstract: Indonesian officials and migrant workers' support group urge Malaysia to punish recruitment agents accused of forcing more than 100 foreign women to work as domestic help without pay, and to enforce laws to protect migrant workers.
lead_paragraph: A case involving the mistreatment of more than 100 migrant workers, mostly Indonesians, drew condemnation from the Indonesian Embassy in Kuala Lumpur on Monday.

headline.main: Malaysia Urged to Protect Domestic Workers
headline.print_headline: Malaysia: Protections Sought for Migrant Workers
